intro: Pongatium zeylanicum, commonly known as the Indian nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves with serrated edges and produces small, greenish-white flowers in clusters. It is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along riverbanks. The plant is known for its stinging hairs, which can cause skin irritation upon contact.
